subject: VAM Pro Motors Not Powering On
description_text:
Just bought the new Simsonn pedals with the VAM Pro motors. They don't even
connect to power. I am furious. I have spent hours troubleshooting and
nothing works. I want this fixed or I am returning.

conversations.body_text: Have update firmware, tried doind a fresh install, plugged power directly to the wall and not the surge protector. I have usb from control box plug right into the pc. I do not understand the issue, about to return and but some simmagic haptics this is actually insane.
Now I am getting errors just having the pedals plugged in... I am about to just send all of this crap back and go buy a Moza pedal set, has to be bettrer than whatever this is.
Now I am getting errors just having the pedals plugged in... I am about to just send all of this crap back and go buy a Moza pedal set, has to be bettrer than whatever this is.
Now I am getting errors just having the pedals plugged in... I am about to just send all of this crap back and go buy a Moza pedal set, has to be bettrer than whatever this is.
Pedal lights are no longer working. Have literally sunk 6 hours into getting these pedals setup and STILL can't use them.

Hi Andrew Ford,  The pedals are showing SIMSONN Flasher mode because you accidentally pressed the upgrade button on the control box. The red message indicates that you should release the upgrade button and re-insert the USB to return to normal working mode. Could you let us know the specific issue you are experiencing? I noticed you left several comments, so I recommend contacting us directly so we can resolve it quickly. Please provide a short video to demonstrate the problem.

I have no lights on the pedals, my haptic motors keep reading “power
disconnect”. My firmware is up to date and pedals are recognized as usb
connected, but for the life of me I cannot get the motors to get power.

On Tue, Sep 16, 2025 at 9:01 PM service@simsonn.com

Hi Andrew Ford,  Please provide your order number and pedal model, and share a screenshot of the software connection interface so I can help you check the issue. Additionally, make sure the USB cable is plugged directly into the blue USB 3.0 port on the back of your PC, and avoid using a USB hub for a more stable connection.

Order#SSN2513
Pro X Ultras with the VAM Pro Haptics

Power is plugged directly into a wall outlet. USB is in directly into the
back of my computer in a blue USB port.




On Tue, Sep 16, 2025 at 9:11 PM service@simsonn.com

I also don’t have lights on the side of the pedals even with power. I’ve
done 3-4 clean installs on the latest version of Simsonn manager.

On Tue, Sep 16, 2025 at 9:26 PM Andrew Ford <andrewford52690@gmail.com>
wrote:

> Order#SSN2513
> Pro X Ultras with the VAM Pro Haptics
>
> Power is plugged directly into a wall outlet. USB is in directly into the
> back of my computer in a blue USB port.
>
>
>
>
> On Tue, Sep 16, 2025 at 9:11 PM service@simsonn.com

Hi Andrew Ford,     It’s abnormal if there are no lights on the pedals. Please first check whether the indicator light inside the control box is on. When testing, do not connect the power for the vibration motors. Simply reconnect the USB. If the pedal lights do not turn on, it indicates that the control box may not be receiving proper power, so please check the USB connection.  You can also test by using a 5V 1A or 2A household charger to directly power the pedal via its USB port. Under normal circumstances, the pedal lights should turn on. If they still do not light up, it is very likely a USB port or power supply issue.  Every control box is fully tested before shipping, so it’s extremely rare for the control box itself to be faulty.

1. I just disconnected the motors and the DC power to the pedals.
   2. Only have USB, throttle, and brake connections hooked up.
   3. Indicator light is on and pedals are still "Connected (USB)"

I had the lights working earlier just fine, but now they have stopped.
Still doesn't explain why the motors aren't working either. The DC hookup
also sparks when I plug it in at the control box.


On Tue, Sep 16, 2025 at 9:37 PM service@simsonn.com
On Tue, Sep 16, 2025 at 9:37 PM service@simsonn.com

Hi Andrew Ford,    The vibration motor uses a 24V power supply, and seeing a spark when plugging it into the control board is normal. This happens because the capacitors inside the control board are charging. It will not damage the board and is completely safe.  Since the voltage is only 24V, please try testing it with another computer. If it’s confirmed that the control board is defective, we will send you a new one free of charge.

What do you mean another computer? I only have my desktop, and my work
laptop.

On Tue, Sep 16, 2025 at 9:53 PM service@simsonn.com

Hi Andrew Ford,  If the pedal lights do not turn on when testing the control box on two different computers, it confirms that the control box is defective. We will send you a replacement control box today. Please provide your order number, contact name, address, and phone number, and we will update you with the tracking number once it has been shipped.

Order#SSN2513
Andrew Ford
11320 Wind Song Ct, Fenton, MI 48430
(810) 772-0889


On Tue, Sep 16, 2025 at 10:03 PM service@simsonn.com

Is a new control box going to fix the motors not working?

Lites and have never had this issues with any of the haptics or pedals and
I can’t even get these ones running, I’ve wasted so much time dealing with
this.

Hi Andrew Ford,    The package will be shipped out tomorrow, and we will provide you with the tracking number as soon as it is available. Since it is already evening today, we appreciate your understanding.

So how long am I going to be waiting for it to arrive? It's been 2 weeks
since I originally ordered... It won't go out until tomorrow, and then I'm
waiting 4-5 more days. Can I just get a return label? At this point, I
think I'm just going to order the Moza's, I don't want to be waiting and
spending time on something that may or may not work.

On Wed, Sep 17, 2025 at 8:44 AM service@simsonn.com
Hello, your parcel has now been dispatched from our US warehouse and should arrive shortly. We apologise for any inconvenience caused.  https://t.17track.net/en#nums=9200190399071902315516

I said I wanted to return these. I’m not waiting about 4-5 days for this.
Please send a return label. I’ve already repackaged everything.

I don’t care about a $30 refund I bought $450 pedals and haptics and they
don’t work. The brake pedal doesn’t even go past 70kg of force, the
software is buggy as all hell and I can’t minimize. I STILL don’t have a
working control box. I purchased over 2 weeks ago and still haven’t been
able to use my rig and have only been told it’s the control box, which I
STILL don’t have tracking for. I’m done, I want these pedals returned.


On Thu, Sep 18, 2025 at 9:51 PM service@simsonn.com

Hi Andrew Ford,     I have reviewed the entire email record again. All of our products undergo thorough testing before leaving the factory, and the LED strips were working properly at that time. If any malfunction occurs, it is most likely due to impact during transportation or abnormal USB power supply, which could cause a fault in the secondary chip and affect both the LEDs and the motors.  We have already sent you a replacement control box. Once you receive and install it, the issue should be resolved.  In addition, if you find that the brake force only reaches around 70kg, we recommend switching to the yellow and blue elastomers, which can provide a higher braking force.

I want a return label, I am not asking again. I am incredibly disappointed
with this entire experience. I spent weeks researching and comparing these
pedals to other products and this is the result, I am livid.

On Sat, Sep 20, 2025 at 9:25 AM service@simsonn.com

​   Hi Andrew,  We completely understand your frustration, and we sincerely apologize for the inconvenience this has caused. Please rest assured that we are fully committed to resolving this issue for you.  Based on our internal checks, every unit is fully tested before leaving the factory. A complete return at this stage may increase the risk of damage during shipping and may not directly solve the problem. From your description, it appears the issue is most likely related to the control box or the power delivery, which can be fully resolved with the replacement control box we have already shipped to you.  Once the new control box arrives and is installed, the pedals and VAM Pro haptics should function as intended. If the brake pressure still feels limited (around 70kg), you can replace the elastomers with the yellow and blue ones included in the package, which are designed to provide higher force levels.  We kindly ask you to allow the replacement to arrive and give it a try — this will be the fastest and most reliable way to restore full functionality. Of course, if any issue remains after the replacement, we will take full responsibility and make sure you have a working solution without additional cost.  Thank you for your patience and understanding. We truly value your trust in choosing SIMSONN, and we are here to make sure you enjoy the full performance of your pedals.

SEND...ME...A...RETURN...LABEL. I am done with this company. None of the
support you guys are offering has worked, this isn't a USB issue. I have
tested multiple connections and multiple different USB ports both
through hubs and direct dconnection to my PC. I am no interested in wasting
anymore time on this. I haven't been able to use these pedals since I
purchased. Send me a return label.

On Sat, Sep 20, 2025 at 9:34 AM service@simsonn.com

I have literally ordered Moza CRP2's they have been delivered, set up, and
working in the time it has taken Simsonn to do literally anything.* Send me
a return **label* I am done with this.

On Sat, Sep 20, 2025 at 9:34 AM service@simsonn.com

Hi Andrew Ford,  The replacement Pro X Ultra control box we sent you has now arrived. Please give us another chance to prove ourselves. Our pedals offer far better value for money than Moza's Crp. https://www.reddit.com/r/simracing/comments/1nlqesi/help_moza_srp_or_simsonn_plus_x_pedals/   https://t.17track.net/en#nums=9200190399071902315516
Hello, I noticed you initiated a chargeback. May I ask if your pedal still isn't working after using the new control box?
